 Be the first one to add a plot.

locations: Big Dave's Tire University Ave, Ft. Worth, Texas, USA
imdb.plot outline: In the 80's "Howlin' Hank" Stevens was on top of the radio heap in Los Angeles. Then all of a sudden he disappeared and fell off the grid. Twenty years later he emerges running a broken down radio station in a small North Texas town. The station isn't much but it's HIS, all his and he is about to lose it. If it's not one it's another. KDIL needs an upgrade, mainly a new radio transmitter. He and his quirky disc jockeys must raise more donations for the homeless shelter in town than the new, corporate radio station that just moved in, or they'll lose the radio-thon. The prize is $100,000 and that is exactly what the gang needs, not too mention if they lose the contest, they lose their broadcast license! Watch as the DJ's of Comanche Springs very own KDIL "The Dillo FM" do whatever it takes to win, including wooing Dallas' most popular radio personality, Mojo Watson into the fold!
imdb.title: Dead Air the Webseries
plot: Chronicles the quirky exploits of "Howlin' Hank" Stevens and his disc jockeys as they struggle to win a Radio-thon for the very survival of their station!.::Jonathan Chauser

In the 80's "Howlin' Hank" Stevens was on top of the radio heap in Los Angeles. Then all of a sudden he disappeared and fell off the grid. Twenty years later he emerges running a broken down radio station in a small North Texas town. The station isn't much but it's HIS, all his and he is about to lose it. If it's not one it's another. KDIL needs an upgrade, mainly a new radio transmitter. He and his quirky disc jockeys must raise more donations for the homeless shelter in town than the new, corporate radio station that just moved in, or they'll lose the radio-thon. The prize is $100,000 and that is exactly what the gang needs, not too mention if they lose the contest, they lose their broadcast license! Watch as the DJ's of Comanche Springs very own KDIL "The Dillo FM" do whatever it takes to win, including wooing Dallas' most popular radio personality, Mojo Watson into the fold!::Jonathan Chauser
